Property.val: INVASIVE MELANOMA OF THE SKIN: Biopsy

Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Protocol applies to melanoma of cutaneous surfaces only.

ListItem.title: Skin of other and unspecified parts of face

ListItem.title: Skin of scalp and / or neck

ListItem.name: LI_937878
ListItem.title: Skin of upper limb and / or shoulder

ListItem.name: LI_937879
ListItem.title: Skin of lower limb and / or hip

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937898
DisplayedItem.title: Please complete a separate checklist for each primary site

ListItem.name: LI_937924
ListItem.title: Low-cumulative sun damage (CSD) melanoma (including superficial spreading melanoma)

ListItem.name: LI_937923
ListItem.title: Melanoma arising in a giant congenital nevus

ListItem.name: LI_937922
ListItem.title: Melanoma arising in a blue nevus

Question.name: Q_937903
Question.title: Maximum Tumor (Breslow) Thickness in Millimeters (mm) (Note D)

ListItem.name: LI_937910
ListItem.title: II (melanoma present in but does not fill and / or expand papillary dermis)

ListItem.name: LI_937911
ListItem.title: III (melanoma fills and expands papillary dermis)

ListItem.name: LI_937959
ListItem.title: Specify number of mitoses per square Millimeter (mm)

Question.name: Q_937934
Question.title: Lymphatic and / or Vascular Invasion (Note H)

ListItem.name: LI_937713
ListItem.title: All margins negative for invasive melanoma

Question.name: Q_937714
Question.title: Distance from Invasive Melanoma to Peripheral Margin

Question.name: Q_937720
Question.title: Distance from Invasive Melanoma to Deep Margin

Question.name: Q_937733
Question.title: ?Margin Status for Melanoma In Situ (required only if applicable)#

Property.name: p_rptTxt_937733_1
Property.val: Margin Status for Melanoma In Situ

DisplayedItem.name: DI_937734
DisplayedItem.title: # Margin involvement by melanoma in situ should be recorded if in situ disease is present in the specimen, and if margins are uninvolved by invasive melanoma.

ListItem.name: LI_937737
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable (in situ disease is absent and margins are uninvolved by invasive melanoma)

ListItem.name: LI_937735
ListItem.title: All margins negative for melanoma in situ

Question.name: Q_937736
Question.title: Distance from Melanoma In Situ to Closest Peripheral Margin

ListItem.name: LI_937725
ListItem.title: Melanoma in situ present at margin

Question.name: Q_937726
Question.title: Margin(s) Involved by Melanoma In Situ

DisplayedItem.name: DI_938056
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT category is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_938056_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT category is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_938076
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_938032
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor (e.g., unknown primary or completely regressed melanoma)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_938073
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Melanoma 1.0 mm or less in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified (Note D)

ListItem.name: LI_938040
ListItem.title: pT1a: Melanoma less than 0.8 mm in thickness, without ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_938033
ListItem.title: pT1b: Melanoma less than 0.8 mm in thickness with ulceration; or Melanoma 0.8 to 1.0 mm in thickness with or without ulceration

DisplayedItem.name: DI_938064
DisplayedItem.title: pT2: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified

ListItem.name: LI_938041
ListItem.title: pT2a: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, without ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_938042
ListItem.title: pT2b: Melanoma greater than 1.0 to 2.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration

DisplayedItem.name: DI_938080
DisplayedItem.title: pT3: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified

ListItem.name: LI_938034
ListItem.title: pT3a: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, without ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_938035
ListItem.title: pT3b: Melanoma greater than 2.0 to 4.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration

DisplayedItem.name: DI_938066
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, ulceration status unknown or unspecified

ListItem.name: LI_938043
ListItem.title: pT4a: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, without ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_938044
ListItem.title: pT4b: Melanoma greater than 4.0 mm in thickness, with ulceration

ListItem.name: LI_938088
ListItem.title: (m) multiple primary synchronous tumors in a single organ

DisplayedItem.name: DI_938152
DisplayedItem.title: For molecular genetic reporting, the CAP Melanoma Biomarker Template should be used. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
